<@!301186049323958275> The top ones are 1559, the bottom ones are escalator. The bottom ones *could* work as a hybrid design too, but there were also some ideas shared verbally on the call that we should sketch up for other ways to achieve an even better hybrid design.

author: sky.cactus
content: Why is the range so high for the top left mockup?

author: sky.cactus
content: The most the base_fee can change in a block is 1/8, which means during a time of transient congestion it will double every 2 minutes.  If your target is 4 minutes, you would have $0.2 - $0.6 (using the $0.2 from your example as current), 6 minutes would be $0.2 - $0.8.

author: sky.cactus
content: Personally, I would probably build tools targeting 2 minute inclusion in all but the worst case scenarios, so $0.2 - $0.4.

author: sky.cactus
content: If the numbers were "random numbers and shouldn't be taken seriously" then feel free to ignore.  ðŸ™‚

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm just worried because there is a lot of confusion around expected behavior post-1559, and I want to make sure people don't actually think that a range like $0.2 to $1 is reasonable (given current parameter choices).
